title: ICE when existential type is exported from one crate and used in another

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

body:
```
rustc 1.30.0-dev
binary: rustc
commit-hash: b5590423e6ceb048dd7d792382e960d66b7615d2
commit-date: 2018-08-16
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.30.0-dev
LLVM version: 7.0
```

`a/Cargo.toml`

```toml
[package]
name = "a"
version = "0.1.0"
```

`a/src/lib.rs`

```rust
#![feature(existential_type)]

pub existential type Foo: std::fmt::Debug;

pub fn foo() -> Foo {
	5
}
```

`b/Cargo.toml`

```toml
[package]
name = "b"
version = "0.1.0"

[dependencies]
a = { path = "../a" }
```

`b/src/main.rs`

```rust
extern crate a;

fn main() {
	let _ = a::foo();
}
```

<details><summary>ICE</summary>

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'librustc_resolve\build_reduced_graph.rs:741: unexpected definition: Existential(DefId(9/0:3))', librustc\util\bug.rs:47:26
```

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/b5590423e6ceb048dd7d792382e960d66b7615d2/src/librustc_resolve/build_reduced_graph.rs#L741

`Resolver::build_reduced_graph_for_external_crate_def` needs an arm for `Def::Existential` ? @oli-obk
